definition: Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson)/Kelvin (temperature scale)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The experiments were conducted in an ultra-high vacuum at the low temperature of 10 Kelvin, with the use of liquid helium.
sentences.chinese: 此次實驗是在10開爾文低溫的超真空環境中完成的。

sentences.english: Lord Kelvin was missing half the story.
sentences.chinese: 開爾文勳爵少算了一半。

sentences.english: If I would heat you up to 3,000 degrees Kelvin, you would become red-hot.
sentences.chinese: 3000開爾文，你會變成一個紅點，你事實上。

sentences.english: Let's draw it in degrees Kelvin, instead of in degrees Celsius.
sentences.chinese: 來重畫一下這幅圖，現在溫度的單位是開爾文。

sentences.english: And then you would get the Kelvin scale.
Consequently the modern mission movement has been partly aresult of the decline of Calvinistic dogmatism.
sentences.chinese: 因此，現代傳道的發展是開爾文教條衰退的一個結果。

sentences.english: He knew he had found Lord Kelvin’s unknown source of heat.
sentences.chinese: 他知道他發現了開爾文勳爵所說的來源不明的熱量。

sentences.english: Where do Kelvin waves come from?
